tags.name: paper-fab-morph
tags.description:
`paper-fab-morph` can be used to wrap a floating action button and another element which is initially hidden, and when tapping the button, it will appear as if the button is morphing into the other element, which appears in its place. This element expects its content to contain two children: one with the class `dropdown-trigger` , which is initially visible and acts as the trigger, and another one with the class `dropdown-content` , which will be hidden until the trigger is tapped. Example: One Two In the example above, the menu will be wrapped by an `iron-dropdown` element and will be positioned relative to the button. Positioning can be modified by setting the `horizontalAlign`, `verticalAlign`, `horizontalOffset` and `verticalOffset` properties. Alternatively, it's possible to set content element with fixed position, which nullifies the dropdown positioning. This is useful for morphing into toolbars and full screen elements for example. It is also possible to use an element which implements overlay behavior as the content, instead of having it wrapped with an `iron-dropdown`. In this case, the `isOverlayContent` property should be set to true. Example:
Dialog
 ### Styling The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|---------- `--paper-morph-background` | Background color of the morphing element | `#fff` `--paper-morph-dropdown` | Mixin applied to the `iron-dropdown` | `{}` `--paper-morph-content` | Mixin applied to the dropdown's content | `{}` Attributes: * `is-overlay-content` {`boolean`} - Whether the content already has overlay behavior. If false, it will be wrapped by an iron-dropdown element, which can be configured with `horizontalAlign`, `verticalAlign`, `horizontalOffset` and `verticalOffset` properties. * `duration` {`number`} - The transition duration in milliseconds. * `horizontal-align` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown horizontally relative to the trigger button. * `vertical-align` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown vertically relative to the trigger button. * `horizontal-offset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the given `horizontalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset to the left, or a positive value to offset to the right. * `vertical-offset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the given `verticalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset towards the top, or a positive value to offset towards the bottom. Properties: * `isOverlayContent` {`boolean`} - Whether the content already has overlay behavior. If false, it will be wrapped by an iron-dropdown element, which can be configured with `horizontalAlign`, `verticalAlign`, `horizontalOffset` and `verticalOffset` properties. * `duration` {`number`} - The transition duration in milliseconds. * `horizontalAlign` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown horizontally relative to the trigger button. * `verticalAlign` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown vertically relative to the trigger button. * `horizontalOffset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the given `horizontalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset to the left, or a positive value to offset to the right. * `verticalOffset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the given `verticalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset towards the top, or a positive value to offset towards the bottom. * `_template` {`HTMLTemplateElement | null`} - * `_importPath` {`string`} - * `rootPath` {`string`} - * `importPath` {`string`} - * `root` {`HTMLElement | ShadowRoot | StampedTemplate | null`} - * `$` - * `_overrideLegacyUndefined` {`boolean`} - * `PROPERTY_EFFECT_TYPES` -

attributes.name: is-overlay-content
attributes.description:
`is-overlay-content` {`boolean`} - Whether the content already has overlay behavior.
If false, it will be wrapped by an iron-dropdown element, which can be
configured with `horizontalAlign`, `verticalAlign`, `horizontalOffset`
and `verticalOffset` properties.

Property: isOverlayContent

Default: false

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description:
`duration` {`number`} - The transition duration in milliseconds.

Property: duration

Default: 200

attributes.name: horizontal-align
attributes.description:
`horizontal-align` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown
horizontally relative to the trigger button.

Property: horizontalAlign

Default: left

attributes.name: vertical-align
attributes.description:
`vertical-align` {`string`} - The orientation against which to align the dropdown
vertically relative to the trigger button.

Property: verticalAlign

Default: top

attributes.name: horizontal-offset
attributes.description:
`horizontal-offset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset to the
left, or a positive value to offset to the right.

Property: horizontalOffset

Default: 0

attributes.name: vertical-offset
attributes.description:
`vertical-offset` {`number`} - A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`. Use a negative value to offset towards the
top, or a positive value to offset towards the bottom.

Property: verticalOffset

Default: 0

tags.name: paper-square-grow-animation
tags.description:
`<paper-square-grow-animation>` increases the element's width and height from an initial
predefined pixel square size to its final size.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'expand-animation',
  node: <node>,
  startSize: <start-size-in-px>,
  timing: <animation-timing>,
}
```

Properties:

  * `_template` {`HTMLTemplateElement | null`} - 

  * `_importPath` {`string`} - 

  * `rootPath` {`string`} - 

  * `importPath` {`string`} - 

  * `root` {`HTMLElement | ShadowRoot | StampedTemplate | null`} - 

  * `$` - 

  * `_overrideLegacyUndefined` {`boolean`} - 

  * `PROPERTY_EFFECT_TYPES` -

tags.name: paper-fab-speed-dial
tags.description:
`paper-fab-speed-dial` builds on `iron-dropdown` to allow showing a list of speed dial actions when tapping on a floating action button. This element expects its content to contain two children: one with the class `dropdown-trigger` , which is initially visible and acts as the trigger, and another one with the class `dropdown-content` , which will be hidden until the trigger is tapped, and will contain the speed dial option elements. Example:
The `direction` property can be set to `top`, `bottom`, `left` or `right` to control the direction in which the options dropdown is expanded. ### Styling The following custom properties and mixins are also available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|---------- `--paper-fab-speed-dial-option` | Mixin applied to each option element | `{}` Attributes: * `direction` {`string`} - The direction in which to expand the options. One of `top`, `bottom` `left` * `offset` {`number`} - A pixel value for the distance of the first option fron the trigger button. * `open-animation-config` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the opening of the options dropdown. * `close-animation-config` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the closing of the options dropdown. Properties: * `direction` {`string`} - The direction in which to expand the options. One of `top`, `bottom` `left` * `offset` {`number`} - A pixel value for the distance of the first option fron the trigger button. * `openAnimationConfig` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the opening of the options dropdown. * `closeAnimationConfig` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the closing of the options dropdown. * `_template` {`HTMLTemplateElement | null`} - * `_importPath` {`string`} - * `rootPath` {`string`} - * `importPath` {`string`} - * `root` {`HTMLElement | ShadowRoot | StampedTemplate | null`} - * `$` - * `_overrideLegacyUndefined` {`boolean`} - * `PROPERTY_EFFECT_TYPES` -

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
`direction` {`string`} - The direction in which to expand the options. One of `top`, `bottom`
`left`

Property: direction

Default: bottom

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description:
`offset` {`number`} - A pixel value for the distance of the first option fron the trigger
button.

Property: offset

Default: 66

attributes.name: open-animation-config
attributes.description:
`open-animation-config` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
opening of the options dropdown.

Property: openAnimationConfig

attributes.name: close-animation-config
attributes.description:
`close-animation-config` {`any[]`} - An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
closing of the options dropdown.

Property: closeAnimationConfig
